titles.title: To designate the National Foreign Affairs Training Center as the George P. Shultz National Foreign Affairs Training Center.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on International Relations.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Committee Agreed to Seek Consideration Under Suspension of the Rules, by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Mr. Leach moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3348.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 407 - 0, 2 Present (Roll no. 470).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.
Senate Committee on Foreign Relations discharged by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 12/5/2001--Passed House without amendment. Amends the Foreign Service Act of 1980 to designate the National Foreign Affairs Training Center as the George P. Shultz National Foreign Affairs Training Center.
